page.title: 05Paul's Day in the village
page.content: I woke up suddenly with the noise of a jet flying overhead. As it passed I heard the steady rumble of tractors right outside the house planting potatoes, King Edwards I expect. I got dressed and had my breakfast of buttered toast and coffee got my bike and set off. I called for my friends and we went to the playing fields with a football. It is right next to St Oswalds Church and they are both out of the main part of the village. After about 2 hours we all went home for lunch. We all met later to ride down Ox Pastures, a rough track for the tractors, and onto the river Trent for a while. Returning to the village two more RAF training jets flew over. Now it was teatime after which I watched T.V. At about 8pm I went out to play Bingo where I won a Babycham and brass plate which I gave to Mum.
